definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to describe sth as/an analogy/a simile/a metaphor/an allegory

sentences.english: In fact, it may empower people to be even more unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，它可能让人们更加不可理喻。

sentences.english: Your comment is simply stupid and does not dignify and intellectual response.
sentences.chinese: 你的评论简直不可理喻毫无智慧光芒。

sentences.english: Is that such an unreasonable thing to hope for?
sentences.chinese: 那么，期盼这样的事情又算不算“不可理喻”呢？

sentences.english: Because the student is mischievous, lets the student eat the bowel movement, impervious.
sentences.chinese: 由于学生调皮，就让学生吃大便，不可理喻。
这简直是不可理喻的事情。
我不过是来试探试探你，没想到你竟不可理喻。

sentences.english: It was mere waste of breath to argue with a person in so unreasonable a state of mind.
sentences.chinese: 和一个如此不可理喻的人争论纯粹是白费口舌。

sentences.english: Caitlin gives an ineffable shrug of her shoulder and shakes her head with her eyes almost closed.
sentences.chinese: 凯特琳不可理喻地耸耸了肩，眼睛几乎闭上地摇着头。

sentences.english: By contrast, to focus on economics and forget security makes no sense at all.
sentences.chinese: 反之，只关注经济而置安防于不顾也是不可理喻的。

sentences.english: The most ridiculous suggestion yet is that the Emperor is still alive.
sentences.chinese: 最不可理喻的说法是鹿王仍然活着。

sentences.english: Zi Gong felt that they were irrational so he went back.
sentences.chinese: 子贡觉得这些人不可理喻，因此就回去了。

sentences.english: People are illogical, unreasonable and self-centered.
sentences.chinese: 人们往往会逻辑混乱，不可理喻，惟我独尊。

sentences.english: Derrick Vinyard would always say the most ridiculous things.
sentences.chinese: 德里克维亚德总是说一些最无可理喻的事。

sentences.english: I am sure foreigners must think our levity is baffling.
sentences.chinese: 外国人肯定认为我们的轻浮举止不可理喻。

sentences.english: This science course is impossible！I will never get an A.
sentences.chinese: 自然课真是不可理喻，我永远得不了A。

definition: to make trouble/to make fun of
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
